title.narrative: (909.21) SOCIAL PROTECTION & POLICY

description.narrative: Children's Right to an Equitable Chance in Life â€“ (a) Children benefit from increased real per capita public expenditure on their rights and development, particularly in health, education, and social protection (b) Child poverty is measured and monitored and increasingly translated into effective social protection policy responses, including through increasing the number of children receiving regular and predictable social transfers (c) Children benefit from adequate, appropriate, integrated, and shock responsive social protection systems and programmes., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children (Covid), Social Protection, Social Protection (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Cross sectoral and Development Effectiveness

sector.narrative: Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Child poverty public advocacy (media and social media, campaigns)

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children?s Right to an Equitable Chance in Life ? (a) Children benefit from increased real per capita public expenditure on theirrights and development, particularly in health, education, and social protection; (b) Child poverty is measured and monitored andincreasingly translated into effective social protection policy responses, including through increasing the number of childrenreceiving regular and predictable social transfers; (c) Children benefit from adequate, appropriate, integrated, and shockresponsive social protection systems and programmes.

description.narrative: Most aspects of the social protection and social policy area of work were completed as per the workplan. Technical assistance to country offices was the primary focus of the work, including continued support related to COVID-19. Several partnerships were strengthened and the Child Guarantee was successfully implemented.; | Status:Met | As-of Date:26/04/2022

title.narrative: of COs supported to have activities that enable Governments to increase the inclusion of excluded children into social protection(68422)
of COs supported to have activities that have data and evidence on how social protection systems are responding to child poverty and deprivations (health, education, nutrition etc.)(68424)
of COs supported to undertake advocacy shaped by child poverty analysis(68418)
of COs supported to have activities that generate evidence on budgets and their linkages to child outcomes to improve budget allocations / expenditures for children(68419)
of COs supported to have activities that support citizen empowerment to participate in sub national budget process to improve budget transparency and accountability(68420)
of COs supported to have activities that Support Governments to develop national measures of child poverty using monetary measures(68417)
of COs supported to have activities that support Governments to develop national measures of child poverty using multidimensional measures(68416)
of COs supported to have activities that enable Governments to have beneficiaries of cash transfers linked to other programs, information and services(68421)
of COs supported to have activities that support Governments to have legislation bylaws and regulation on cash transfers and/or family benefits(68423)
